text: Philippe Sanfourche (France, January 26, 1975) is a French sports journalist, who works as a senior reporter in the sports department of RTL (French radio) and then as a radio and television host. ==Career== "On refait le match" is also a daily podcast to keep up to date with all the latest football news. He is a columnist on the show "L'Equipe du soir" on the L'Ã‰quipe channel (television channel). Other reports for RTL, Dakar Rally from 2004 to 2010, Tour de France cycling race 2008, won this year by Carlos Sastre ahead of Cadel Evans. The French Open tennis tournament from 2000 to 2003, in the Roland-Garros stadium in Paris, an annual clay court tennis tournament. He will make regular appearances on Pascal Praud's show 20hFoot. Philippe Sanfourche is a specialist in the French football team and Paris Saint-Germain FC at the sports department since 2010.https://www.sport- tv.org/personnalite/philippe-sanfourche/https://www.rtl.fr/auteur/philippe- sanfourchehttps://viadeo.journaldunet.com/p/philippe- sanfourche-1685121https://www.toutelatele.com/marseille-salzbourg-qui-est- philippe-sanfourche-le-remplacant-de-denis-balbir-aux-commentaires- sur-w9-99629 ==References== Category:1975 births Category:French journalists
title: Philippe Sanfourche
